intro: Swartzia multijuga var. lomatopus, commonly known as the yellowwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Leguminosae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in various habitats including forests and riverine areas. The tree is characterized by its dark, heavy timber and its striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of timber due to its hard and durable wood. The plant also plays an important ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
